results.title: The Outsider
results.creator_credit: Country Education Project and Barry Washington
results.brief_description: Richard McRoberts and Gary Kinnance begin the discussion with a brief survey of Albert Camus’ life and philosophy to set a background for a fuller treatment of the book. Specific passages are used as springboards for the analysis and explication of Camus’ themes. The meaning and place of “The Outsiders” as a piece of existential literature is discussed.

results.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
results.creator_credit: Malpaso Company, Robert Daley and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: Josey Wales (Clint Eastwood) becomes physically and emotionally scarred when Union gorillas murder his family and destroy his Missouri farm. Turning vigilante and ending up with a price on his head, he journeys to Texas and becomes a much-feared Confederate raider. Wales becomes the unwilling centre of a loose community when he picks up survivors of a wagon train ambushed by Comancheros (engagingly played by an excellent supporting cast which includes Sondra Locke). Ultimately, Wales can’t bring himself to leave his motley surrogate family unprotected. Eastwood had not intended to direct as well as star in his twenty-sixth feature film. The directorial assignment had been given to co-writer Phil Kaufman who exited from the picture early on during location shooting and Eastwood, taking over, performed a first-rate job. The film also received an Academy Award nomination for music.

results.title: The Outlaw
results.brief_description: A highly fictionalized account of the rivalry and tenuous friendship between Billy the Kidd (Jack Beutel), Doc Holliday (Walter Huston), Pat Garrett (Mitchell Thomas) and a half breed girl (Jane Russel in her screen debut). Much controversy surrounded the films release regarding supposedly steamy scenes between Jack Beutel and Jane Russel, and Hughes’ obvious fixation with Russel’s chest.

results.title: The Otto cycle: gasoline engine
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and Visual Aids Committee, American Association of Physic Teachers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “College Physics”.
Graphically presents the six processes in the gasoline engine cycle. The ideal situation with the elimination of disturbing factors is demonstrated and the Otto cycle is traced on a pressure-volume diagram. The concept of thermal efficiency is discussed in this film.

results.title: The Other World
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roman Bittman and Claudia Overing
results.brief_description: An exploration of the world of plant and animal life in a Canadian stream. Using underwater and microphotography film techniques, the camera follows some of these underwater life cycles and shows the interdependence of insect, fish and mammal life, which in turn are dependent upon the purity of the water.

results.title: The Other Thailand
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Alan Bateman and Geoffrey Barnes
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
This program, presented by Keith Adam, describes the southern area of Thailand where the majority of the people are Muslim. It explores the industries in the area and the conflicts with the northern Buddhist population.

results.title: The Other son
results.creator_credit: Heng Tang, Rachel Roberts and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Vera is the meticulous wife, mother and reigning matriarch of her palatial home. She manages her domestic domain with digital clockwork precision. It is 7pm and dinner time. Her dutiful husband and beautiful son take their designated places at the table. However, the tranquillity is interrupted by the sudden appearance of an intruder threatening to shatter Vera’s utopia. Original format 35mm/colour.

results.title: The Other sister
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Mario Iscovich, Alex Rose and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: When a mentally challenged young woman returns home from an institution, she craves independence not willingly granted by her loving but overprotective mother. After meeting a mentally handicapped man, Carla experiences romance and the desire for a life unencumbered by others’ limited expectations of her. Cast includes Juliette Lewis, Diane Keaton, Tom Skerritt, Giovanni Ribisi, Poppy Montgomery, Juliet Mills.

results.title: The Other side of the coin = Il Rovescio della medaglia
results.brief_description: Documentary film about post World War II Italian migrants living in somewhat depressed circumstances in Sydney. A group of Italian men discuss their situations since arriving in Australia, the discrimination, their inability to obtain a decent paying job no matter how skilled they are, their inadequate living conditions and lack of money and education, and the threat of deportation if their political beliefs (particularly those of socialist/communist persuasion) are too radical in the minds of the incumbent Liberal government (1978) whose politics of assimilation appear to be the driving force. Loneliness and alienation are part of daily existence amongst the migrant community, more so with the older generation as their children having been taught English at school, refuse to speak Italian at home. There appears to be a sense of a loss of culture and language contrary to the perception that post-war Australia is made up of a multilingual and multicultural society. The background story to the film which provides the basis for discussion about migrant rights is the deportation in 1978 of a radical community worker, Ignazio Salemi. Includes archival footage of Italian labourers working the Queensland cane fields during the 1950s.
